body:
You need to have the loop.v1 and loop.v2 on your system to actually -- you know -- build software that depends on them.  This software will depend on them being in the right paths (loop.v1 and loop.v2) -- so your problem is basically that you don't like adding git remotes to them?   You would rather have a 3rd place (canonical)... so your "better" workflow would be...

edit 3rd (canonical) place, git add, git commit, git push, go get -u loop.v2, go test thingThatDependsOn.loop.v2

rather than adding a remote, and doing "go test thingThatDependsOn.loop.v2"
